author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
A Standard IX student of Government High School at Iduvai, R. Krishnasamy (15), sustained injuries in an accident when a teacher reportedly sent him to buy tea during class hours on Thursday morning.

While returning with tea in a plastic sachet, a motorcycle hit the boy. Krishnasamy sustained injuries on his lower forearm.

He was treated at a private hospital and admitted to the district headquarters hospital after Students Federation of India (SFI) members intervened.

Krishnasamy told The Hindu that he was sent to buy tea by his science teacher Manimeghalai. “She asked me to take the bicycle of another student and get tea quickly from a particular shop,” he said.

R. Vimal, SFI district secretary, said, “The school authorities initially tried to downplay the incident. It was the boy’s uncle who informed me of the incident. Soon after, the SFI members intervened and the boy was sent to the district headquarters hospital for an X-ray.”

School version

When contacted, school headmaster M. Mani blamed the SFI members for blowing the issue up.

But, when asked whether the incident took place or not, he said the teacher in question was not feeling well and had asked the boy to get tea and a pill.

However, the boy said he was asked to buy only tea.

“I will be submitting a report to the Education Department on Friday seeking a departmental action against the teacher,” Mr. Mani said.

According to SFI the school authorities tried

to downplay

the incident
title: Boy sent to buy tea by teacher injured in accident
